definition: to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
a unit of length/inch/thumb
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
(negative prefix)/not/no
mythical beast (archaic)
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
surname Li

sentences.english: That day and the next, Arthur refused to leave the Chimney Rock.
sentences.chinese: 之后的日子里，亚瑟待在烟囱岩上寸步不离。

sentences.english: My shy little sister clung to me like aleechall through the party.
sentences.chinese: 我那腼腆的小妹在聚会上寸步不离地跟着我。

sentences.english: Other fans watch the games at home, glued to their TV sets.
sentences.chinese: 其它的球迷则守在家里寸步不离地收看电视转播。

sentences.english: May happiness follow you everywhere ...just like we do.
sentences.chinese: 愿快乐随时与您同在，就如同我们与您寸步不离一般。

sentences.english: Never let James and Sirius out of his sight.
sentences.chinese: 总是跟詹姆和小天狼星寸步不离的。

sentences.english: Most guys will follow the woman everywhere, and not leave her side for a minute.
sentences.chinese: 大多数男人会随处跟随女人，并且寸步不离。

sentences.english: He sticks to her like glue, ie never leaves her.
sentences.chinese: 他如胶似漆地寸步不离开她。

sentences.english: The maintenance guys really worked to keep their jets together.
sentences.chinese: 维护人员真的是与他们维护的飞机寸步不离。

sentences.english: It followed my footsteps with a pertinacity which it would be difficult to make the reader comprehend.
sentences.chinese: 它跟我寸步不离，这鼓拧劲儿读者确实难以理解。

definition: to protect/to guard/to shield
to nurse/to look after/to watch over/(old) hospital nurse
to blindly follow suit (idiom)/to imitate slavishly/to do what everyone else is doing
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
to look after/to attend to/to have in care
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
to keep totally silent/noiselessly
local guide/tour escort
to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
in every possible way (idiom); meticulous
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
the utmost care (idiom); to look after sb in every possible way
to follow obediently
to not say a word
to tend/to take care of sb
